response.stringValue: Hi! Welcome to AAFA's Asthma Health chat bot

title.stringValue: My name is Juliana, and I'm here to help you understand asthma and how to manage living with it. I can also help you understand your health insurance options and give you some useful tips

response.stringValue: I've been trained by experts and will provide you with information, tools and tips to help prevent and manage asthma episodes and understand your health insurance coverage options.

title.stringValue: What would you like to learn more about? Also, at any time you can type in your question below.

response.stringValue: I’d like to help, but I don’t understand! Try asking me again
I tried my best, but it may be better if I connect you with a human.
If you post your question on AAFA’s community, another community member or AAFA’s staff will reply within a few hours: https://community.aafa.org/create-topic
If you have a more private question, you can send it to AAFA using this form: https://www.aafa.org/contact Please allow up to 2 days for a response.

text: Sorry, I didn't get that. Can you rephrase?

response.stringValue: When someone has asthma, their airways are inflamed
Asthma is a chronic disease, which means this inflammation is long-lasting, and needs managing

title.stringValue: What would you like to go over first: the common symptoms or the signs of a severe asthma emergency?

response.stringValue: The common symptoms of asthma are:

title.stringValue: That's what happens on the outside - would you like to know what happens on the inside?

response.stringValue: When someone experiences an asthma episode, the airways to the lungs are no longer fully open and breathing becomes difficult

title.stringValue: Now that you know the common symptoms, care to talk about the signs of a severe asthma emergency?

response.stringValue: A severe asthma episode is a medical emergency. That's why it's very important to know the signs

title.stringValue: Because there is no cure for asthma, taking medications and avoiding triggers is the best way to manage it
Now that we've gone over symptoms, would you like to talk about asthma treatment, or how to prevent an asthma episode?

response.stringValue: I have a lot of information about different types of treatment. Although I will say that you should work with your doctor to find the best treatment for you

title.stringValue: What are you interested in learning about first?

response.stringValue: An inhaler is a medical device that allows medicine to go directly to your lungs. Inhalers are different than nebulizers. Nebulizers are machines with tubing that takes liquid medicine and turns it into a mist that you inhale
There are 2 types of inhalers:

title.stringValue: It's also very important that you use your inhaler as directed - almost half of people who use inhalers use them incorrectly
Which treatment method would you like to go over next? Or would you like to talk about severe-specific treatments instead?

response.stringValue: You can treat asthma with long-term control medicines. These would be taken every day for the best results 😊
There are several kinds of long-term medicines:
Oral corticosteroids, like prednisone, are also used in short bursts to treat a severe asthma episode
If you need two or more bursts of corticosteroids in a year, it is a sign that your asthma is not controlled

title.stringValue: If you have difficult-to-control asthma, you may want to discuss biologics as an advanced treatment with your doctor
Which treatment method would you like to go over next? Or would you like to talk about severe-specific treatments instead?

response.stringValue: Hi! Welcome to AAFA's Asthma Health chat bot

title.stringValue: My name is Juliana, and I'm here to help you understand asthma and how to manage living with it. I can also help you understand your health insurance options and give you some useful tips

response.stringValue: If a service is covered, this means that your insurance company will pay all, or some of the cost

title.stringValue: In order to see which services are covered under your healthcare plan, you should look at the Summary of Benefits and Coverage section of your plan

response.stringValue: I’d like to help, but I don’t understand! Try asking me again

text: I didn't get that. Can you say it again?

response.stringValue: If a service is covered, this means that your insurance company will pay all, or some of the cost

title.stringValue: In order to see which services are covered under your healthcare plan, you should look at the Summary of Benefits and Coverage section of your plan

response.stringValue: The Summary of Benefits and Coverage, sometimes called an SBC, is a required document for every healthcare plan
It is an easy-to-understand summary about your plan's benefits and coverage
All insurance companies must provide you with this document — you can find it on your health insurance website

title.stringValue: Would you like more information on the SBC for job-based plans, Marketplace plans, or grandfathered plans?

response.stringValue: All job-based plans must come with an SBC

title.stringValue: If you're unable to find the information in your healthcare plan, call your insurance company and ask them to provide it for you 😊
Can I tell you about how you can ensure your insurance company is applying your benefits correctly?

response.stringValue: For each medical bill you receive, you should also receive an explanation from your insurer
This is known as the Explanation of Benefits, or the EOB
The EOB will typically show the following:

title.stringValue: Was that helpful?

response.stringValue: Reading and understanding your EOB is important because you'll be able to see if your insurance and benefits are being applied properly
To make sure the benefits were applied correctly, compare your summary of SBC with your EOB
If you have any concerns, or questions about what was and wasn't covered, you can call the customer service number on the EOB document

title.stringValue: Care to talk about any of these topics?

response.stringValue: To clarify, a medication is considered "covered" if your health insurance company will pay for all, or some of the cost of the medication
To find out whether or not a medication you need is covered by your healthcare plan, you should look at the drug formulary
A drug formulary is a list of prescription medications that are covered by an insurance plan — sometimes called a drug list

title.stringValue: Can I give you tips on how to navigate your insurer's drug formulary?

response.stringValue: Visit your insurer's website to review a list of medications your plan covers
You may be able to purchase some drugs that are not on this list — but you'll have to pay the full cost out-of-pocket 😒
Keep in mind that the medications on your plans drug formulary can change year-to-year

title.stringValue: Your insurance company should notify you of any changes, but it's still a good idea to check your insurer's website to be safe

response.stringValue: It can be a good idea to call your insurance company directly to inquire about what's covered
In order to find out how you and your insurance company split the costs, see your Summary of Benefits and Coverage (SBC)

title.stringValue: Do you want more information on the SBC?
